snippet: The family of a woman who was killed in 2010 after her ignition switch failed revived the previously settled case, claiming that the company fraudulently concealed evidence.
abstract: General Motors is unable to persuade Georgia judge to dismiss case that helped set in motion company's worldwide recall of 2.6 million cars with deadly ignition defect; family of Brooke Melton, woman who was killed in 2010 after her ignition switch failed, revived the previously settled case, claiming that the company had fraudulently concealed evidence.
lead_paragraph: The family of a woman who was killed in 2010 after her ignition switch failed revived the previously settled case, claiming that the company fraudulently concealed evidence.

headline.main: G.M. Loses Bid to Dismiss Suit Over Switch
headline.print_headline: G.M. Loses Bid to Dismiss Suit Over Switch
